intro: Fagonia boulosii, commonly known as the desert henna or false henna, is a shrub native to arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is drought-tolerant, making it well-suited for harsh desert environments. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Fagonia boulosii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
